This podcast is here to showcase interviews that give personal insight and real experiences from our guests and hopefully myself to provide the audience a chance to see and hear how everyone uses music in their life.

description:
L Files Pubcast is brought to you from Lulie Tavern Abbotsford. 
This local music news pubcast will keep you up to date with all of the latest Melbourne music as well as checking out international classics.

title: Bounce FM

The beauty of a podcast is that you can listen to it anytime anywhere, a new episode is released every Friday but will remain available for the forseable.

Welcome to Whack or Slaps, where we look back into the annals of 2000s indie music to determine if an album, or band, or even entire musical movement was actually good or just a product of the hype machine of its time. 

Like all great podcasts this is a direct spinoff of an unhinged and sketchy group text, that simply refuses to die.

title: We Sing the BASS Electric
description: Welcome to We Sing the BASS Electric, a podcast for bass lovers and music enthusiasts of all genres!  Join us as we revisit some of the most iconic recordings from different bassists, past and present, and discuss behind-the-scenes insights and stories about the most revered albums of our time - all from a bass player's point-of-view.  Hosted by bassist, composer and international recording artist Christian de Mesones, also known as Big New York.

6 Young English lads discussing various Music based topics.

The menu may change from each episode but the recipe will always stay the same…conversations with no compass. All aboard the giggle train, next stop is high five mountain!

title: Dad Educates Daughter
description:
A Podcast where a Dad educates his Daughter on 80s music now that she's old enough to appreciate the songs and videos that she used to associate as outdated, rubbish music when being subjected to it in the car on the way to school.
Each week Rebekah will listen to some 80s musicians her Dad, Russell, recommends and will then discuss on the Podcast what she thought of the songs, videos and image of the musicians. Russell will share information on chart placing and overall success of the singer/band.
We will find out if Rebekah thinks the music has stood the test of time as she gives her verdict as to whether it's a hit or a miss!

title: Musicians' Teatime
description:
Hosted by Gabi Chesnet and Cyd Levine, Musicians’ Teatime is a short interview-style podcast about the music industry past, present and future.
Guests are welcomed to talk about their experience and relationship to music, but this can encompass their history, anecdotes, philosophy, life lessons or even casual talk relating to their life’s work. We raise topics relevant within today’s music industry and how they may relate to the state of things 20, 30, 40 years ago- or, you know, maybe not, if the mood’s rather up to ranking which modes sound the best.

Lie back in your seat, kick your feet up, grab a hot drink and tune in!

All episodes come with a full transcript and translation into French.

title: Alteriior the Show
description: I don't know why I made a social media-based platform for music reviews, but I did and it's called Alteriior. I also don't know why I made a podcast that is derived from said platform, but I did and it's called Alteriior the Show (FKA Alteriior: But Make It a Podcast). This show looks at current releases from alternative scene genres such as metalcore, post-hardcore, pop punk, deathcore and anything else that falls under our weird little branch. Graphic designs with review scores for these releases can be found on the Alteriior Twitter and Instagram, while TikTok has retro reviews for past releases. Thanks for tapping in, and for the love of the game, let's make a scene.

title: Johnny I. Presents: TKO - The Official Podcast
description: You are in the ring with DJ/Producer Johnny I.!  TKO is your go-to monthly podcast for the best in house, tech house, tribal, and techno ... and it's a total knockout!

title: Travel Notes

Hosted by Grace McNally, listeners will travel to the far corners of the globe - listening to people & musicians who illustrate the richness of the culture, music and similarities between seemingly different parts of the world. Pack your bags because our next trip is just around the corner!

title: Titanic Reaction with Tony Mengis
description:
"I was born and raised in Portland, Oregon, one of the best underground music scenes in the world. I got into the underground metal scene in the early eighties and found punk a few years later. Sometimes for better, sometimes for worse, punk has been one of the biggest influences of my life ever since. I've been in a few bands and toured every chance I got. I've been a booker at a few clubs and even owned a couple. With my background, I was excited to see my niece and nephew get into punk. I was also a little worried, but they are smarter than me so have avoided making the same mistakes. It made me wonder what, after almost 50 years, still attracts people to the subculture. Also, what keeps people involved into their 30’s, 40’s, 50’s and beyond. Charlie Harper is in his 70’s and has been touring since 1976. I’ll be talking to bands from around the world, and also people who keep punk alive behind the scenes. I’ll be asking them what attracted them to punk in the first place and what keeps them around for decades. I’m looking forward to the conversations, because sometimes I can't even answer it for myself. Beware, there will be a lot of talk about Portland. I moved to Amsterdam a few years ago and miss Portland every day, so I love to hear stories about it. Also, as much as I hate some things about it, it is one of the best cities on earth. Also beware, these are real stories- well, most of them are. They will contain tales of alcohol, drugs, sex and extreme violence and language that Mary Whitehouse would not approve of. Take caution and thank you listening, I appreciate each and every one of you."
Written and Hosted by Tony Mengis Produced & Edited by Chelsea Clyde Mixed and Mastered by Joe Mengis

description: This podcast takes a deep dive into the backstory of any number of cultural phenomena that shock, appall or captivate modern audiences. title: The Scheme Team Podcast
description: Join the Scheme Team every week as they host the Scheme Team Podcast! Following a different theme each week, the team often go on to talk about their own personal stories growing up in Scotland and enjoy reminiscing. Each week follows different themes from gaming to movies to music. Primarily a YouTube group you can also watch their podcast on their YouTube channel!

title: Crazy Radio Stories
description: Radio didn't used to be all about corporate consolidation and out-of-market voicetrackers.  There was a time when we had full staffs! And with that many dysfunctional people in one building, some pretty wild stuff used to happen - both on and off the air. Chances are, if you worked in this business, you've got some crazy stories to tell. Crazy Radio Stories is the podcast that tells the world how radio USED to be.  Few rules, and in some cases, even fewer morals.  If you've got a crazy radio story to tell, email us - crazyradiostories@gmail.com.

title: Música Chisme y Cubitas
description:
Porque la buena música tiene un chismecito atrás. 

Podcast de todo música y más, para los fanáticos de lo que es bueno en la vida. 

Con tus hosts favoritos: Fernando Del Conte, Jesús Iturralde & Javi De La Vega

title: Country On Me Podcast
description: Country On Me Podcast is about all things country music. We are hopefully going to do lots of interviews with people from the country music world. I hope y'all enjoy the podcast.

title: Caropop
description: There may be nothing more inspiring and entertaining than relaxed, candid conversations among creative people. Mark Caro, a relentlessly curious journalist and on-stage interviewer, loves digging into the creative process with artists and drawing out surprising stories that illuminate the work that has become part of our lives. The Caropopcast is for anyone who wants to dig deeper into the music, movies, food and culture that they love.

title: Babblin' Bangers
description: I mostly babble about some bangers, but in a good way.

title: Toons With Goons
description: Anna and Brynne are two best friends that are exploring different artists, albums, songs, and genres of music. They will be doing several deep dives into artists' backgrounds and music history. Along with this, they will explore the concert settings and share experiences and tips on how to go about concerts. Come with Anna and Brynne as they widen their music taste and explore new music!

title: Chant School
description:
Love Gregorian Chant but can't sing it? The Chant School podcast is designed to help you sing the ancient chants of the Church with ease. 

In the Chant School, you will learn the most ancient melodies and texts in the Christian tradition.  St. Hugh of Cluny once spoke of how the learning, practicing, and singing of Gregorian chant is a sure way to grow in holiness, in closeness to the Word, and in submission to the discipline of singing God’s praises. Floriani has taken these words to heart, and it is our intent to inspire and educate the next generation of Catholic musicians in the spirit of this beautiful inheritance.  We hope you enjoy learning how to sing Gregorian Chant -- the greatest artistic treasure of the Catholic Church!

title: KULTÚRA, ÖKOLÓGIA, BOTANIKA - KERT A KÖBÖN
description:
Kert a köbön - avagy a tudományos-kulturális szórakoztatás az ökológiai szemléletformálás oltárán.
Az Ökológiai Kutatóközpont egyedülálló projektje 2021 nyarán izgalmas estekkel, valamint egy háromnapos fesztivállal várta a látogatókat Vácrátóton, a Nemzeti Botanikus Kertben.
Az ország legjelentősebb ökológiával foglalkozó intézeteit tömörítő Ökológiai Kutatóközpont útjára indította a Kert a köbön eseménysorozatát, amely tényleg köbre emelte hazánk első számú botanikus kertjét: egymás mellé állította a kultúrát, az ökológiát és botanikát. 
A multidiszciplináris és multikulturális programsorozat fő célja volt olyan témák boncolgatása ‒ közérthetően és nyári könnyedséggel ‒, amelyek fontosak az ökológiai szemléletformálás szempontjából. A projekt hidat teremtett a tudományos és művészeti megközelítés között, hogy a valóság megértéséhez egy átfogóbb képet kapjon a társadalom.
A programsorozat beszélgetésekkel összekötött koncertélményekkel várta a közönséget. A borkóstolós, nyár esti társalgások sajátja volt, hogy különböző területről érkeztek szakemberek: többféle tudományterületről, a gyakorlati életből, a művészetből és a médiából egyaránt. 
A nyár végén háromnapos Kert a Köbön Fesztivállal zárult a különleges és hagyományteremtő kezdeményezés, amelynek középpontjában az ökológia, az irodalom és a zene állt. 
Mindez egy kétszáz éves történeti kertben, amely kiemelkedő természeti és kulturális gazdagságával fogadta be az eseményeket.

title: The Sound of Cinema
description:
Zonder muziek blijft er weinig over van een film. Want hoe eng is Jaws zonder geluid, hoe episch Star Wars zonder aanzwellend orkest? En hoe verliefd zijn Olivia Newton John en John Travolta zonder discobeat? Film schuurt, film knalt, film zucht, film klikt. En Filmhuis Den Haag laat het allemaal horen. In deze podcast reis je door de geschiedenis van de filmmuziek. Open je oren voor intiem pianospel, melancholische strijkers, opzwepende discobeats... of juist helemaal niets. Luister mee en je ziet meer!

The Sound of... is een klinkend programma dat schuurt, knalt, zucht en klikt. Met talks, podcasts, playlists, expo’s en meer, open je je ogen voor alles wat film te bieden heeft. Nieuwe geluiden, vertrouwde geluiden, tegengeluiden – Filmhuis Den Haag laat ze weerklinken. Luister mee en je ziet meer!

Meer weten? Ga naar https://filmhuisdenhaag.nl/the-sound-of-cinema

title: 12 Notes
description: Music, like people, is a journey. Through time and space, reaching all four corners of the globe. Throughout history, both music and social justice have been so deeply intertwined because, ultimately, both depend on the way we feel and the way we interact with each other. Music, like us, is always finding new ways to be unique. But ultimately, it's all made up of the same 12 Notes.

title: Far Off Sounds Podcast
description:
Far Off Sounds is a webseries of documentaries about the infinite story of music on Earth. From harsh industrial noise performed for fish in an aquarium, to a heavy metal cruise ship in the Caribbean, Far Off Sounds has been filming the ways that humans use and engage with music for a decade. 

The Far Off Sounds Podcast expands on this project. The show's creators, Jacob Hurwitz-Goodman and Nick George, interview ethnomusicologists, experimental musical meme pedagogues, musicians, label artists, journalists and others in long-form conversations about music, as well as providing a behind-the-scene glimpse at the doc series' production.

In addition to concert reviews, you'll get a dose of history, stats, facts, and surprises along the way. Get on the bus for Workingman's Pod: Talkin' Dead with Alex and Dave!

title: The Back Lounge Podcast

title: Groove Train Radio
description:
Step aboard the GROOVE TRAIN and take a sonic journey transcending time, tastes and genres to seek out and explore an ongoing program of R&B, Roots & Soul, Blues, Folk & Jazz & Rock "n" Roll, some Country & Funk and before we stop we're not afraid to play some Pop. Any sound that makes you move and broadcasts a deep and definitive groove.... So pop those fingers, tap those toes, shimmy those shoulders, shake your hips to and fro..... 
Every Wednesday afternoon 4:00pm to 6:00pm 
ALL ABOOAAARRRD... The GROOVE TRAIN...

title: Stefan och Ulfs podcast
description: Välkommen till denna podcast där två reliker från en svunnen tid dammar av minnen från förr. Du får äran att i varje avsnitt följa Stefan och Ulf på deras resa från att de först gjorde sin bekantskap i lumpen år 1983, till idag nästan 40 år senare. Resan är fylld med anekdoter och musik från det glamorösa 80-talet, poppande 90-talet hela vägen till idag. Tillsammans skissar Stefan och Ulf ett vackert om än sällsamt porträtt av en vänskap som bestått tidens prövningar. Häng med!

title: streetRAPisHistory
description:
Los Angeles history through rap.

LA is full of history and culture. Many of the major streets were named after people who were influential in California settlement and development. In this podcast, we dive into the non-fiction stories of California settlement, presenting each as a rap. Prepare to laugh, learn, and be entertained.

title: 52 The Podcast
description:
"52 – The Podcast" with Kristian Bush and Cindy Watts celebrates the stories behind Bush's new and award-winning songs. Original episodes will be released for free every week for 52 weeks. 

Bush, half of the Grammy-winning duo Sugarland, half of the critically acclaimed Americana folk-rock duo Billy Pilgrim and a founding member of rock group Dark Water, is releasing 52 songs over the next year in honor of his 52nd birthday on March 14, 2022.  

The album project, also called "52," will come out in four volumes over the next 12-to-18 months. 

Each episode of "52 – The Podcast" will explore the relationship between one of the popular songs from Bush's back catalog and one of the new songs from "52." Bush and Watts give insight into the songwriting process, the singer/songwriter's day-to-day life, and the musical journey that took him from his hometown of Sevierville, Tenn., to Atlanta, Nashville, and around the world as part of his various bands. 

Fun fact: Bush and Watts, a CMA Award-winning country music journalist, are from the same hometown. They share poignant moments, hilarity and plenty of dad jokes as they wind their way through their middle-age in the music business experience and Bush's life of songs.

title: Jazz Backstory
description:
The podcast series, Jazz Backstory, is based on the holdings of the Fillius Jazz Archive (https://www.hamilton.edu/campuslife/arts-at-hamilton/jazzarchive) located at Hamilton College (https://www.hamilton.edu/), in Clinton, New York. Established in 1995, and dedicated in 2013 in honor of Milton F. Fillius, Jr. ’44 and Nelma “Nikki” Nenneau Fillius, the Fillius Jazz Archive holds a collection of over 440 videotaped interviews with jazz musicians, arrangers, writers and producers. The wide-ranging collection includes interviews with sidemen, soloists and band leaders who have performed from the 1920s through the present. 

Jazz Backstory podcast episodes will feature interview excerpts focused on topics inherent to the creative life. Artists, both famous and unsung, relate these tales in their own jazz inflected vocabulary. Original music and commentary from the host help set the tone, both educational and swinging.

Monk Rowe (https://www.monkrowe.com/), creator of the podcast series, Jazz Backstory, and the Joe Williams Director of the Fillius Jazz Archive, conducted the majority of  the interviews and has presented programs about the resource at conferences for the Jazz Education Network, the Music Library Association, and the International Society of Music Educators. Monk co-authored with Romy Britell  the book Jazz Tales From Jazz Legends on Hamilton’s Couper Press and created the edX online course, “Jazz: The Music, The Stories, The Players” in collaboration with members of the Library and Instructional Technology Services at Hamilton College. He is an active performer on saxophone and piano and has composed numerous works for both jazz and classical ensembles.

Through his unique interviewing style, Aditya aims to share the musical journeys of these maestros with people of India and beyond. With a growing listener base on Instagram and radio (Big FM Shillong & Aizawl), Aditya is emerging as one of India's pioneering music podcasters, focusing exclusively on interacting with internationally acclaimed musicians. In just a year, he has interviewed renowned legends like Joe Satriani, Cindy Blackman Santana, Phil Perry, Bob James, Lee Ritenour, Doyle Bramhall II, Eric Martin, Nathan East, Richard Bona, Paul Carrack, Victoria Canal, and many others.

Season 1 comprised over 50 remarkable episodes, and Season 2 promises even more by featuring international legends and music industry experts from India. title: Caravan of Pain: The True Story of the Tattoo the Earth Tour
description: Brace yourself for a roller coaster thrill ride as you join the Tattoo the Earth 2000 summer tour of America, the most insane tour ever inflicted on a continent. Featuring twenty of metal’s biggest bands, including Metallica, Slipknot, and Slayer, plus Filip Leu, Sean Vasquez, and the world’s best tattoo artists, these renegade outsiders pissed off all the wrong music business heavyweights but left delirious inked fans in their wake. "Caravan of Pain" is a rip-roaring music business underdog tale: compelling, hysterical, and cautionary. Its unique peek inside the world of music festivals, metal, and tattooing gives the reader a front row seat to a watershed time in our culture at the turn of the millennium. "Caravan of Pain" is a story of inspiration, persistence, and the dark side of following a dream. Narrated by Khristian Lee

title: Sock Hop Saturday Night
description:
It's easier to say what the show ISN'T! This show ISN'T your typical, consultant-driven oldies show that only plays the same 300 songs over and over until you are sick of hearing them. It ISN'T robot-radio with a personality-less host and lots of liner cards. It ISN'T a show that tells listeners they can't request a song they want to hear instead of the consultants choice.

What it IS is a unique, weekly oldies radio program that caters to its base of dedicated fans and regular listeners. It's different every week with the ability to draw from a playlist of over 17,000 titles! Its host, Mark Edwards, brings life, personality and interaction to the show. It's fans are loyal followers with many listening from the opening intro to the close.

The mission statement could be summed up as: "At least once each broadcast, you'll roll your eyes back, place your hand on your forehead and say wow, I haven't heard this song in years!'
It began with uncertainty in 1994 but eventually turned into a ratings success story.  Mark Edwards brought his creativity, charm and music collection to the airwaves of Connecticut to bring listeners on a trip back in time.  So successful that it achieved the highest ratings of any show on the station’s lineup during its last Arbitron entry.  His unmistakable ability to give the audience what they wanted paved the way for success for over 28 years! The key to that success was, and still is, the diverse playlist. Thousands of songs from not only the “Hit Makers” of the time, but lesser known, but equally important groups.  Groups like The Academics, Accents, Admirations, Lee Andrews & The Hearts, Angels, Barons, Bell Notes, Blenders, Blossoms, Blue Notes, Bop Chords, Boss Tones, Cadets, Cadillacs, Calvanes, Cameos, Capris, Cardinals, Carnations, Cavaliers, Cellos, Earl Lewis & The Channels, Chaperones, Charms, Chimes, Chords, Cleftones, Clovers, Crests, Crows, Danleers, Darts, Defenders, Del Vikings, Dells, Demensions, Desires, Dominos, Dootones, Dreamlovers, Dubs, Duprees, Earls, Edsels, Emeralds, Eternals, Falcons, Fantastics, Fascinators, Five Keys, Five Royales, Five Satins, Flamingos, G-Clefs, Genies, Harptones, Heartbeats, Impalas, Inspirators, Jacks, Jaguars, Jewels, Jesters, Jive Bombers, Keytones, Bob Knight Four, Kodaks, Legends, Little Joe & The Thrillers, Love Notes, Frankie Lymon & The Teenagers, Lewis Lymon & The Teenchords, Magnificents, Marcels, Medallions, Mellows, Midnighters, Monarchs, Moonglows, J Neons, Nino & The Ebb Tides, Nobles, Nutmegs, Orchids, Orioles, Paragons, Paradons, Pearls, Penguins, Pentagons, Platters, Pyramids, Queens, Quin Tones, Ravens, Rays, Revlons, Rivieras, Rob Roys, Royal Jesters, Royal Teens, Scarlets, Schoolboys, Sensations, Shells, Shep & The Limelites, Sheppards, Solitaires, Spaniels, Starlites, Titans, Tokens, Top Notes, Treniers, Turbans, Universals, Uniques, Untouchables, Valentines, Valiants, Van Dykes, Velours, Videls, Videos, Vito & The Salutations, Wanderers, Wheels, Willows, LITERALLY TO NAME JUST A CHOSEN FEW!!!

description: Welcome to Six String Hayride, a journey through the world of classic country music. Each episode is hosted by Chris Wainscott and Jim O’ Malley. Join us in the cart as we ride through topics such as murder, prison, mama, your favorite artists, the songs they gave us, and the stories that made them. Each episode will focus on a unique topic, presented in an interesting and informative way. Think of it as history meets yarn spinning. Season One will feature discussions on topics as wide-ranging as murder ballads, what is wrong with Rolling Stone’s Top 20 Country Album list, Western music, artists of color, and why Delia shouldn’t be gone. Whether you’re a diehard country music fan, a casual fan, or someone who isn’t yet aware that you like country, we’ll have something to entertain you, as well as educate you. Each episode will contain a featured recipe straight from the kitchen of those who gave us this music. Join us on our Facebook page for discussions, the recipes, songs, and more. So come along for the ride and let’s get cooking. Follow us on Facebook at Six String Hayride. Contact Us at Sixstringhayride@yahoo.com. Six String Hayride is Researched, Written, and Narrated by Chris Wainscott and Jim O'Malley. Script Editor and Business Manager, Chris Wainscott. Audio Recording and Production, Jim O'Malley. The show was started in 2021 by DJ Big X as a way to hear and connect with new artists and their music but grew into a podcast. Today, The We Outside Show focuses on breaking new music, paying homage to the OGs and generating conversation that informs and drives culture. #WeOutside

title: Jazz Lab
description: Jazz Lab is an hour show that seeks to immerse the listener in jazz music, culture and history. In this show, we explore the lore of jazz history and dive into the best of America’s art form. Each episode features a different set of tracks and stories from a collection of artists as we follow the careers of these greats through the albums that defined them and connected them to other innovators of the day. In Jazz Lab, we develop a love and appreciation for America’s music through incredible stories and iconic records.

Questa magia, Claudio l’ha scoperta nel 1988 e non riesce proprio a farne a meno.

Agli ascoltatori di Rsc- Radio Studio Centrale, offre Solo Cose Belle, dalle 12:00 alle 14:00, da Lunedì a Venerdì, ma state in campana perchè arriveranno Solo Cose Belle, anche quando meno ve l’aspettate.

Gli History Hit, le canzoni del passato, proposte da Solo Cose Belle, sono sempre delle chicche per veri intenditori.

E non dimenticate di scaldare le corde vocali, perché ogni giorno con ‘Canta che ti passa’, chiunque può cantare e dimostrare le proprie doti canore.

title: La Satanoteca

Aquí te mostraré mis perversiones musicales, mis hallazgos, mis sugerencias y mis críticas sobre las bandas y los géneros que me obsesionan. Si te gusta la música que te sacude, que te lleva a otros planos, que te reta y te asombra, este es tu podcast. Únete y sígueme en esta aventura sonora por La Satanoteca.

title: The Discursive Power of Rock en español and the Desire for Democracy
description:
This podcast examines the perennial quest of Latin Americans and Latinx peoples to create more just and equitable societies. The series focuses on the political project of Latin American rock en español, a musical genre that challenged the hegemony of English rock and began in the 1970s.

During the 1970s, a number of Latin American countries were faced with dictatorships and military coups that led to the “dirty wars” in which citizens were traumatized, tortured, and murdered. This project will be examining the lyrics for main themes of social justice that circulated during the dirty wars of Mexico, Chile, and Argentina in particular.

We will also feature intergenerational conversations to examine the legacies of this music in our present moment and how Rock en Español was employed by LA Latinas and Latinos to fight against anti-immigrant rhetoric and politics in 1990s California.

This project is supported in part by the University of California Office of the President MRPI funding M21PR3286.

title: 头号广播 DONN RADIO
description:
双人电波是一档由插画师BrolySu跟制作人好友FridayWav一起闲聊交流的嘻哈音乐分享栏目。每期我们都会挑几首喜欢的Hip-Hop来跟大家分享，目的就是为了推广更多我们觉得尖的音乐人和作品。从一起在美国留学的时期我们私下就会经常碰面做这件事，也感谢互联网的便利，能够持续让我们在不同的地方推进音乐分享。

DONN Radio is a hip-hop music-sharing column where illustrator BrolySu chats with producer friend FridayWav. In each episode, we will select a few favorite Hip-Hop songs to share with you, the purpose is to promote more musicians and works that we think are top-notch. Since we both studied at Indiana University, we have often met privately to do this. We are so grateful for the convenience of the Internet, which allows us to continue to promote music sharing in different places.

title: On Top of the World
description:
On Top of the World is a music history podcast hosted by Shane Louis. New episodes release on Friday.

Originally as a 5 episode series, On Top of the World started as my senior undergraduate thesis (or Independent Study / I.S.) at the College of Wooster under the title Forever On My Mind. I majored in History with a minor in Education, and decided to do my final senior thesis on my favorite genre of music: the blues. With the help and encouragement of the History Department of the College of Wooster, I was able to create 5 episodes outlining my historical argument. I explored the songwriting of blues musicians in the 1960s, when their genre was most popular.

Now, the podcast has become my own median of storytelling and historical thinking when it comes to music. I hope you enjoy my eccentric storytelling, overly-poetic descriptions, and occasional jokes in my podcast.

Podcast Instagram: @ontopoftheworld1930

linktree: linktr.ee/shanelouis

Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/ShaneLouis

For business inquiries: officialshanelouis@gmail.com

title: Montevideo Sonoro
description:
Montevideo Sonoro. Un recorrido musical por la ciudad.

Distintas líneas, distintos orígenes y destinos. Un único método de transporte, la música que nos une. Montevideo Sonoro es un programa realizado y conducido por Nicolás Hidalgo y Diego Castro en Radio Belcha, un mapa musical que nos invita a conocer distintos caminos que forman parte de nuestras vidas. Desde la Aduana al Prado. Desde Malvín a Belvedere. Desde Pocitos a Paso Molino, recorreremos a nuestro Montevideo, zonas, barrios y las historias que se encuentran atrás de cada canción.

Idea, conducción y producción: Nicolás Hidalgo, Diego Castro. Inspirado en el proyecto ideado y creado por Gabriel Bentancor y Daniel Machín.

Por aportes musicales y otras sugerencias entrá a montevideosonoro.uy y dejá tu granito de arena para seguir agrandando este mapa musical colaborativo.

Montevideo Sonoro es una intervención urbana y un proyecto interactivo de georreferenciación, puesta en valor y divulgación del patrimonio musical de la ciudad.

Montevideo Sonoro. Un proyecto en constante construcción. Ciudad viva, en movimiento.

title: Entrevista a los hijos del compositor Tomás Méndez
description:
Entrevista a los hijos del compositor Tomás Méndez autor y compositor de Cucurrucucú paloma, Paloma negra, Leña de pirúl y otros éxitos mas.

En la casa de El Indio Fernández coincidió con Lola Beltrán y se convirtió en su compositor de cabecera. Con ella, en 1952 alcanzaron el éxito La luna dijo que no, Que me toquen las golondrinas, Tres días, Desafío, Gorrioncillo pecho amarillo, Huapango torero y la internacional Cucurrucucú paloma.

Otras obras de su autoría son Las rejas no matan, Los amigos del mayor, La muerte, A los cuatro vientos, Cuando canta la paloma, Puñalada trapera, El tren sin pasajeros, La muerte de un gallero, Paloma déjame ir, Golondrina presumida, Paloma negra, Suspenso infernal, El ramalazo, Bala perdida, El globero, No le temo a la muerte, Leña de pirul y Laguna de pesares, por mencionar algunas que fueron encumbradas por artistas como Pedro Infante, Javier Solís, Amalia Mendoza La tariácuri, Lucha Villa y María Dolores Pradera.

title: Musical Tangents

Valerie and Loui don't promise any answers, but just geeky conversations that motivate you to think and ponder upon some of these topics.

And as all the dirt covers our skin.

We danced bare-footed in the grass.

We read big, heavy books and we would smile.

Our only drug was love.

And boy did we get high, oh, how we smoked each other up.

And as all the leaves rustle above us.

And as all the dark covers our skin.

Rest your head onto my chest.

Oh, is this really the end?

We worked hard and we made lots of money.

And when we had enough to be happy, we gave the rest away.

We were good with what we had.

And as all the leaves rustle above us.

In the life we could have had.

title: ELEKTROPİ: Elektronik Müziğe Dair Podcast Serisi
description:
Elektropi serisi, ses şeridi üzerinde yapılan müziğin yani elektronik müziğin doğasına inebilme amacıyla düzenlenen bilgilendirici bir podcast serisidir. Bu seride; müziğin ulaştığı son noktayı tanıma yolunda elektronik müziğin tarihine, ilk atılımlarına, türlerine, füzyonlarına, önde gelen bestecilerine ve son olarak dj’lik sanatına değineceğiz. Yeri geldiğinde akıcılığı sağlamak adına türleri müzik üzerinden örneklerle değerlendirerek anlatmak istediklerimizin pekişmesini sağlayacağız.

Elektronik müziğin derinlerine yaptığımız bu turda Ecem ve ekip arkadaşı Arın size rehberlik edecek.

title: Piano Kitchen Sessions Mixed and Compiled by Fuego
description:
Welcome Piano Kitchen Sessions Mixed and Compiled by Fuego," a mixtape dedicated to the emerging artist who's setting the Amapiano scene ablaze. Fuego, a talented producer and DJ, brings the heat with infectious beats and soulful melodies. Get ready to groove to his signature sound and exclusives from other artists around the genre of amapiano.

Piano Kitchen Sessions has taken us on a musical adventure through the world of Amapiano. This emerging artist has proven his talent as a producer and DJ, leaving a fiery mark on the genre. Keep an eye out for Fuego as he continues to rise and set the dance floors ablaze with his scorching beats and infectious tunes.

title: T'Nime Përnime (URBAN FM)
description: “T ‘nime Përnime” eksploron në thellësi proceset e krijimtarisë muzikore, prej muzikës klasike, asaj folklorike, nëpërmjet rock and rollit e muzikës pop, e deri te hip-hopi e elektronika. Muzikanti Arbër Salihu gjithashtu i njohur si La Fazani, ka me analizu dhe shtjellu kompozime, tekste, aranzhmane dhe produksione të ndryshme përgjatë shumë dekadave që përfshijnë stile të larmishme muzikore. Përveç se analizohet aspekti muzikor e artistik i albumeve, duke përfshirë produksionin, kompozimet, performanca, kopertina, kurimi etj, gjithashtu studiohet impakti shoqëror që këto albume kanë pasur në kohën që janë lansuar. Para se te filloj emisioni, duhet të lëshohet albumi për të cilin po flitet në tërësi. T’nime pernime me Arber Salihu çdo të merkure nga ora 21:00 deri në 22:00 në 103.5 dhe 105.5 FM Web: radiourban.fm

title: The 11th Hour: A Rancid Podcast
description: A podcast where two dudes in their 40s discuss a different Rancid song each week. Join us on a journey to the end and find out... THE 11TH HOUR IS NOT AFFILIATED WITH RANCID

title: The Saxophone History Podcast
description: A thoughtful, researched, and slightly irreverent look at the most interesting players in our history. Join us as we bring to life the stories of some of the most important people, events, and pieces of repertoire from the history of our instrument. This podcast will go deep into the lives of players from all different styles and look critically at players as diverse as Sigurd Rascher and Clarence Clemons. Sources, links, and other info can be found at http://www.andrewdmeyer.com
